name: fishhook
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
a curved piece of metal with a barb (= a sharp point that curves backwards) at one end, used for catching fish: The fishhooks were baited with feathers fastened with coloured silk threads. He learned how to remove a fish-hook from a trout's mouth.
a shape consisting of a line with a curved part at one end, similar to a fish hook or a letter J: The buildings form a fish hook with the museum at the point. They redrew the electoral district in what was described as a fishhook shape.
More examplesFewer examplesSome of the sardines still had fishhooks snagged in their mouths.At the sanctuary, aquatic birds are treated for broken legs and wounds from fish hooks.She baited her fish hook with a worm.We travel south and then west along Bermuda's fish-hook.
